title: The Integration Path
subtitle: An 8-Week Journey to Becoming Whole
description: The flagship course bringing together all four pillars—Mind, Body, Soul, and Relationships—into one comprehensive transformation journey. This is the deep work of integration: understanding your patterns, healing what's wounded, building new capacities, and becoming the person you're meant to be.

modules.title: Week 1: Foundation
modules.description: Understanding integration and mapping where you are

modules.title: Week 2: The Body
modules.description: Nervous system, embodiment, and physical foundation

modules.title: Week 3: The Shadow
modules.description: Meeting and integrating the disowned self

modules.title: Week 7: Meaning
modules.description: Purpose, values, and what you're here for

modules.title: Week 8: Integration
modules.description: Bringing it all together for lasting change

whatYouLearn: Map your current state across all four pillars
Regulate your nervous system and build capacity
Heal attachment wounds and relate more consciously
Create a sustainable practice for ongoing integration
requirements: Commitment to 8 weeks of consistent practice
Willingness to examine all aspects of your life honestly
Time for daily practices (15-30 min) and weekly deep work (60-90 min)

questions.question: What are the four pillars of integration in this framework?
Why is the body considered foundational in integration work?
options: The nervous system underlies our capacity for all other work
You need to look good to feel good

questions.question: What is the relationship between shadow work and patterns?
options: Shadow material often drives unconscious patterns

questions.question: What role do emotions play in integration?
options: They should be controlled and minimized
They carry important information and need to be felt and processed

questions.question: How do limiting patterns typically form?
options: Through adaptive responses to early experiences that no longer serve

questions.question: What does 'meaning' refer to in the integration framework?
options: Purpose, values, and what gives your life significance

questions.question: Why is integration an ongoing process rather than a destination?
options: Because life continues presenting new material to integrate
Because you can never be fully healed

questions.question: What is the goal of examining relationships in integration work?
options: To understand patterns, heal attachment wounds, and relate more consciously
